| Label Label Label Label
1. Active tab: Indicates which destination of the navigation bar is currently being
displayed.
2. Skapa icon: Used to support the text label in the navigation bar. Choose commonly
known icons that communicate the destination clearly.
3. Text label: Provides short, meaningful descriptions of navigation bar destinations.
4. Elevation line: Makes the bottom bar container to stand out from rest of the content.
5. Bottom Navigation container: Holds equal-width columns of navigation bar
destinations including icon, text label, and active tab indicator.

Scrolable area
Links can be reached by Tab, and Enter key is used to activate links. The numbers indicate the order of the keyboard interaction.
Landmarks
Ingka Co-worker Design applies a navigation landmark around the Bottom Bar
Navigation. If a page includes more than one navigation landmark, each should have a
unique label. This help people who use assistive technology to make a mental model of
a screen's content.
